description.narrative:
The project will provide emergency response to the most vulnerable households (HHs) in Nangarhar who are affected by flood and needemergency response for immidiate response. Oxfam is To ensure protection and reduce the suffering of flood affected families in Nangarhar province through rehabilitation of Water infrastructures and provision of short-term work opportunities through cash for workapproach, Support most vulnerable households affected by the flood in Kuz Kunar district of Nangarhar province of Afghanistan to earn wages, repair houses or community infrastructures and civic protection. This project design was based on the finding of oxfam’s need assessement in flood affected communities and households in Nangrahar province, Oxfam team and its partner will ensure implementation of Oxfam’s emergency response, MEAL and Gender minimum standards in emergencies.
Initial reports suggested as many as 2,049households were affected by flooding on 26 August 2020 in Afghanistan. More than 145 people were killed and another 167 sustained injuries across 11 provinces. In Nangarhar, the flood has affected 9121 families and resulted to death of 2 and 3 are seriously injured.
Two main activities through this project have been proposed one is the Provision of Cash for Work to 50 Households (family with7 members) as per FSAC Cluster monthly food package which is 117 AUD per month (6500 AFN) and second one is the construction of damaged water infrastructure in the targeted area. Oxfam initial response in Nangrhar province, Kuz Kunar District (Targeted province for this fund) Oxfam partner NCRO conducted flood assessment to collect data and information about damages of agriculture, water infrastructures and livestock in Kuz Kunar district of Nangarhar province. The assessment revealed that, 40% of respondents identified cash, 18% preferred food, 6% education, 6% shelter, 25% WASH, and the rest of the 5% health facilities as first priorities. Similarly, 15% identified food, 27% cash, 25% preferred education, 11% preferred health facilities, 4% preferred shelter, and the rest 5% preferred WASH as second priorities.

participating-org.narrative: NCRO was established with a view to serving the needy Afghans, particularly Afghan Returnees from neighboring countries and internally displaced persons IDPs due to natural disasters or internal conflicts in Afghanistan. NCRO is a fully voluntary organization andprovides services to the aforementioned categories of people, irrespective of gender, race, language or geographical locations. NCRO assistance is always free and within the rules and regulations of the country. It never seeks compensation or reimbursement from its beneficiaries. NCRO is registered as a nongovernmental organization, with the Afghanistan government (Ministry of Economy).

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to life and security
